section.title: Vehicle features and options
section.paragraph: This chapter describes model-specific equipment, systems and functions that are available now and will be available in the future, even if they are not available in the owned vehicle.
Additional information:
Vehicle equipment.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Two vehicle keys are included in the scope of delivery, each containing an integrated key.
Each vehicle key contains a replaceable battery.
Depending on the equipment and national-market version, various settings are possible for the button functions.
A BMW ID or a driver profile with personal settings can be assigned to a vehicle key.
To provide information on maintenance recommendations, the service data is stored in the vehicle key.
To prevent possible locking in of the vehicle key, take the vehicle key with you when exiting the vehicle.

overview.overview-text: Vehicle key not in range of children

warning.paragraph: Warning

The vehicle key has a button cell battery. Batteries or button cell batteries can be swallowed and lead to serious or fatal injuries within two hours, for example due to internal burns or chemical burns. There is a risk of injury or danger to life. Keep the vehicle key and batteries out of reach of children. Immediately seek medical help if there is any suspicion that a battery or button cell battery has been swallowed or is located in any part of the body.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Buttons on the vehicle key.

section.title: Additional vehicle keys
section.paragraph: Additional vehicle keys are available from an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

section.title: Loss of vehicle keys
section.paragraph: A lost vehicle key can be disabled and replaced by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.
If the lost vehicle key has an assigned BMW ID or driver profile, the connection to this vehicle key must be deleted. A new vehicle key can then be assigned to the BMW ID or driver profile.

overview.overview-text: Do not use unsuitable batteries

warning.paragraph: NOTICE

Improper batteries in a battery-operated device can damage the device. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Always replace the discharged battery with a battery with the same voltage, the same size and the same specification.

action-step.paragraph: Press and hold the button, arrow 1, and push the cover, arrow 2, forward and remove it from the side.
Remove the battery housing from the vehicle key to the side.
Remove the battery from the battery housing.
Insert a CR2032 3V battery with the positive side facing down.
Insert the battery housing into the vehicle key.
Insert the cover into the vehicle key.
Remove the integrated key from the vehicle key.
Place the integrated key underneath the battery compartment cover, arrow 1, and lift the lid with a lever movement of the integrated key, arrow 2.
Push battery in arrow direction using a pointed object and lift it out.
Insert a CR2032 3V battery with the positive side facing up.
Press the lid closed.
Push the integrated key into the vehicle key until the integrated key engages.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Have old batteries disposed of by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop or take them to a collection point.
Dispose of spent batteries according to the regulations of the proper authorities.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The vehicle can be locked and unlocked without the vehicle key using the integrated key.
The vehicle can be unlocked without the vehicle key using the integrated key.
Depending on the national-market version, the integrated key will fit in the glove compartment.
Depending on vehicle model and equipment, the front passenger airbag key switch can be operated with the integrated key.

overview.overview-text: Do not lock from the outside

warning.paragraph: Warning
For some national-market versions, unlocking from the inside is only possible with particular knowledge.
Do not lock the vehicle from the outside when passengers are present in the vehicle because unlocking from the vehicle interior is not possible.

If persons spend a lengthy time in the vehicle and are thereby exposed to extreme temperatures, there is a risk of injury or danger to life. Do not lock the vehicle from the outside when there are people in it.

action-step.paragraph: Press and hold the button, arrow 1, and push the cover, arrow 2, forward and remove it from the side.
Slide out the integrated key at the open side of the vehicle key.
Remove the integrated key from the vehicle key.
Press the button, arrow 1, and pull out the integrated key, arrow 2.
Pull off frame from integrated key.
Pull and hold the door handle outward with one hand.
Unlock the door lock with the integrated key by turning it counterclockwise.
Unlock the door lock with the integrated key by turning it clockwise.
Press the cover cap in.
The cover cap is slightly opened.
Pull the cover cap to the side so that the door lock is clearly visible.
Unlock the door lock with the integrated key.
Remove the integrated key from the door lock.
Press the cover cap in to close it.
Press the cover cap in again to open it slightly.
Pull on the cover cap until the door opens.
Pull and hold the door handle outward with one hand.
Guide one finger of your other hand from the back under the cover cap and push the cover cap out.
Use the thumb for counter support to prevent the cover cap from falling out of the door handle.
Remove the cover cap.
Unlock or lock the door lock using the integrated key.

section.paragraph: The other doors must be unlocked from the inside.
The other doors must be unlocked using the central locking button or manually from the inside.

section.title: Locking via the side door lock

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Side door lock in the driver's door.

action-step.paragraph: Slightly open the driver's door.
Lock the side door lock with the integrated key.
Close the driver's door.

section.paragraph: If necessary, lock the other doors from the respective side door lock as well.

section.title: Locking the vehicle from the interior
General information
section.paragraph: The vehicle can be locked manually from the inside.
To avoid locking the vehicle key in the vehicle, do not place the vehicle key in the vehicle.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Door pin for manual locking of the driver's door.

action-step.paragraph: Close the driver's door.
Press the door pin in the driver's door downwards from the inside.
Lock rear doors from the inside.
Open the front passenger door and lock it manually.
Close the front passenger door from the outside.

section.title: Alarm system
section.paragraph: If the vehicle is unlocked with the integrated key via the door lock, the activated alarm system will be triggered when the door is opened.
In this case, use the vehicle key emergency detection to switch off the alarm.
If the vehicle is locked with the integrated key via the door lock, the alarm system will not be activated.
If the doors are manually locked from the inside, the alarm system is not activated.

section.title: Emergency detection of the vehicle key
section.paragraph: It is not possible to switch on the drive-ready state if the vehicle key has not been detected.
Proceed as follows in this case:

action-step.paragraph: Hold the rear of the vehicle key against the mark on the steering column. Pay attention to the display in the instrument cluster.

item.paragraph: If the vehicle key is detected:
Turn on drive-ready state within 10 seconds.
If the vehicle key is not detected:
Slightly change the position of the vehicle key and repeat the procedure.

section.title: Malfunction
section.paragraph: A Check Control message is displayed where applicable.
Vehicle key detection by the vehicle may malfunction under the following circumstances:

item.paragraph: The battery of the vehicle key is discharged.
Fault of the radio link from transmission towers or other equipment with high transmitting power.
Shielding of the vehicle key due to metal objects.
Do not transport the vehicle key together with metal objects.
Fault of the radio link from mobile phones or other electronic devices in direct proximity to the vehicle key.
Do not carry the vehicle key in close proximity to other electronic devices.
Fault of radio transmission by a charging process of mobile devices, for instance charging of a mobile phone.
The vehicle key is located in direct proximity of the wireless charging tray.
Place the vehicle key in a different location.
Fault of the radio link during charging of the vehicle.

section.paragraph: In the case of interference, the vehicle can also be unlocked and locked from the outside with the integrated key. Use the Emergency detection of the vehicle key to turn on drive readiness.

overview.overview-text: Carrying a vehicle key

warning.paragraph: Warning

People or animals in the vehicle can lock the doors from the inside and lock themselves in. In this case, the vehicle cannot be opened from the outside. There is a risk of injury. Take the vehicle key with you so that the vehicle can be opened from the outside.

overview.overview-text: Do not lock from the outside

warning.paragraph: Warning
For some national-market versions, unlocking from the inside is only possible with particular knowledge.
Do not lock the vehicle from the outside when passengers are present in the vehicle because unlocking from the vehicle interior is not possible.

If persons spend a lengthy time in the vehicle and are thereby exposed to extreme temperatures, there is a risk of injury or danger to life. Do not lock the vehicle from the outside when there are people in it.

overview.overview-text: Do not leave children or animals unattended in the vehicle

warning.paragraph: Warning
Unattended children or animals in the vehicle can cause the vehicle to move and endanger themselves and traffic, for instance due to the following actions:

item.paragraph: Pressing the Start/Stop button.
Releasing the parking brake.
Opening and closing the doors or windows.
Engaging selector lever position N.
Using vehicle equipment.

warning.paragraph: There is a risk of accidents or injuries. Do not leave children or animals unattended in the vehicle. Take the vehicle key with you when exiting and lock the vehicle.

section.title: Actions during unlocking
section.paragraph: Depending on the settings, the following functions are performed when unlocking the vehicle:

item.paragraph: Only the driver's door and the fuel filler flap will be unlocked or all access to the vehicle will be unlocked.
Only the driver's door will be unlocked or all access to the vehicle will be unlocked.
Only the driver's door and the charging socket cover will be unlocked or all access to the vehicle will be unlocked.
The unlocking of the vehicle can be confirmed with a light signal or a sound signal.
The welcome light can be turned on when the vehicle is being unlocked.
After opening a vehicle door, the window can be lowered more to make it easier to get into the vehicle.

section.paragraph: In addition, the following functions are executed:

item.paragraph: If a BMW ID or a driver profile was assigned to the vehicle key, this BMW ID or driver profile will be activated.
The interior lights are switched on, unless they were manually switched off.
Depending on vehicle equipment, folded-in exterior mirrors are folded out.
If the exterior mirrors were folded in via the button in the vehicle interior, they will not be folded out during unlocking.
Anti-theft protection is switched off.
The alarm system is switched off.

section.paragraph: Additional information:

item.paragraph: Settings.
Welcome lights.
BMW ID/driver profiles.

section.title: Actions during locking
section.paragraph: Depending on the settings, the following functions are performed when unlocking the vehicle:

item.paragraph: The locking of the vehicle can be confirmed with a light signal or a sound signal.
Depending on vehicle equipment, the exterior mirrors can be folded in automatically when locking. The exterior mirrors are not folded in when the hazard warning flashers are switched on.
Pathway lighting can be activated during locking.

section.paragraph: The following functions are executed:

item.paragraph: All doors, the tailgate, and the fuel filler flap are locked.
All doors, the tailgate, and the charging socket cover are locked.
All doors and the tailgate are locked.
Anti-theft protection is switched on. This prevents the doors from being unlocked using the lock buttons or the door openers.
The alarm system is switched on.

section.paragraph: If the drive readiness is still turned on when you lock the vehicle, the vehicle horn will honk twice. In this case, the drive-ready state must be switched off by means of the Start/Stop button.
Additional information:
Settings.

section.title: Unlocking the vehicle

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Press the button on the vehicle key.

section.paragraph: If only the driver's door and fuel filler flap have been unlocked due to the settings, press the button on the vehicle key again to unlock the other vehicle access points.
If only the driver's door and charging socket cover have been unlocked due to the settings, press the button on the vehicle key again to unlock the other vehicle access points.
If, only the driver's door has been unlocked due to the settings, press the button on the vehicle key again to unlock the other vehicle access points.
After opening one of the front doors, the vehicle is ready for operation.
The lighting functions may depend on the ambient brightness.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Press the button on the vehicle key twice in direct succession to activate comfort entry.
Depending on the settings, the window will be lowered further when a door is opened.

action-step.paragraph: Close the driver's door.
Press the button on the vehicle key.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The vehicle can be accessed without operating the vehicle key.
The vehicle key is automatically detected near the vehicle.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The function is available with Comfort Access.
Depending on the national-market version, the vehicle can also be unlocked and locked at the external door handle with compatible smartphones with a digital key.
Additional information:
BMW Digital Key.

item.paragraph: Carry the vehicle key with you, e.g., in your pants pocket.
Bluetooth must be activated on the smartphone to unlock and lock using the Digital Key.
To lock the vehicle, the vehicle key must be outside of the vehicle near the doors.
After locking, approx. 2 seconds must elapse before unlocking is possible.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Reach into the recessed grip of a front door.

section.title: Unlocking the vehicle at the rear door

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Press and hold the button in the recessed grip to unlock the vehicle and open the rear door.

action-step.paragraph: Close the driver's door.
Touch the grooved surface on the external door handle of a closed front door with your finger for approx. 1 second without reaching into the recessed grip.

section.title: Malfunction
section.paragraph: Wet or snowy conditions may disrupt the locking request detection on the external door handles.
In the case of a malfunction, unlock and lock the vehicle using the buttons of the vehicle key or use the integrated key.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: When the driver approaches the locked vehicle with the vehicle key, the vehicle is unlocked.
When the driver walks away from the unlocked vehicle with the vehicle key, the vehicle will be locked.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The function is available with Comfort Access.
The vehicle will be unlocked when an authorized vehicle key is detected in the unlocking zone.
The unlocking zone is located within a radius of approx. 1.50 m1.50 m, 5 ft5 ft/1.50 m around the vehicle.
The unlocking zone is located within a radius of approx. 1.50 m1.50 m, 5 ft5 ft/1.50 m around the side and rear of the vehicle.
The vehicle will be locked when the vehicle key leaves the locking zone.
The locking zone is located within a radius of approx. 3 m3 m, 9 ft9 ft/2 m around the vehicle.
The locking zone is located within a radius of approx. 3 m3 m, 9 ft9 ft/3 m around the side and rear of the vehicle.
Depending on the national-market version, touchless unlocking and locking is also possible for compatible smartphones with a digital key.
If the vehicle key is located in the unlocking zone for an extended period of time without movement, the vehicle will be locked automatically.
If a passenger is detected in the front passenger seat during locking and the seat belt of the front passenger is engaged in the seat belt buckle during locking:
If a person is detected on a seat during locking:

item.paragraph: The vehicle will be locked but not secured against theft.
The fuel filler flap remains unlocked.
The charging socket cover remains unlocked.

section.paragraph: Additional information:
BMW Digital Key.

section.title: Actions during unlocking
section.paragraph: If the settings specify that only the driver's door and the fuel filler flap will be unlocked, note the following:
The driver's door and fuel filler flap will only be unlocked when the driver approaches the vehicle on the driver's side.
If the settings specify that only the driver's door and the charging socket cover will be unlocked, note the following:
The driver's door and the charging socket cover will only be unlocked when the driver approaches the vehicle on the driver's side.
If the settings specify that only the driver's door will be unlocked, note the following:
The driver's door will only be unlocked when the driver approaches the vehicle on the driver's side.
Additional information:
Settings.

section.title: Functional requirements

item.paragraph: Carry the vehicle key with you, e.g., in your pants pocket.
Unlocking: when entering the unlocking zone, the doors and cargo area must be closed.
Locking: when leaving the locking zone, the doors and cargo area must be closed.
Bluetooth must be activated on the smartphone for contactless unlocking and locking using the Digital Key.
Automatic unlocking and locking must be activated in the settings.
The drive-ready state must be turned off.
For contactless locking of the vehicle, no second vehicle key may be within a radius of 6 m6 m, approx. 18 ft18 ft/6 m around the vehicle.
If the vehicle has been in the idle state for several days, contactless unlocking/locking will only be available after the vehicle has been driven.

section.paragraph: Additional information:
Settings.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The Key Card is a chip card on which the digital key is installed. It can be used to unlock and lock the vehicle.
Additional information:
Key Card.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The Key Card is available with Comfort Access.

section.title: Locking/unlocking the vehicle

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Hold activated Key Card directly on the center of the external door handle of the driver's door.

section.paragraph: When locking the vehicle with the Key Card, make sure that all doors and the trunk are closed.
If the Key Card is not detected, slightly change the position of the Key Card and repeat the procedure.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Depending on the national-market version and equipment, a digital key can be installed on a compatible smartphone and used to unlock and lock the vehicle.
Additional information:
BMW Digital Key.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Hold the near field communication antenna of the smartphone directly and centered on the external door handle of the driver's door. The position of the near field communication antenna depends on the smartphone model.
When locking the vehicle with the smartphone, make sure that all doors and the trunk are closed.

section.title: Frequently Asked Questions
section.paragraph: What precautions can be taken to be able to open a vehicle, despite accidentally locking in the vehicle key?

item.paragraph: The options provided by the Remote Services of the BMW app include the ability to lock and unlock a vehicle.
This requires an active BMW ConnectedDrive contract and the BMW app must be installed on a smartphone.
Unlocking the vehicle can be requested via the BMW ConnectedDrive Call Center.
An active BMW ConnectedDrive contract is required.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The cargo area will be opened to the configured opening height.
It may not be possible to open the cargo area when the vehicle is in valet parking mode.
Additional information:
Valet parking mode.

overview.overview-text: Keep the travel path of the trunk lid unobstructed

warning.paragraph: Warning
Body parts can be jammed when operating the trunk lid. There is a risk of injury. Make sure that the travel path of the trunk lid is clear during opening and closing.

overview.overview-text: Keep the travel path of the tailgate unobstructed

warning.paragraph: Warning
Body parts can be jammed when operating the tailgate. There is a risk of injury. Make sure that the travel path of the tailgate is clear during opening and closing.

overview.overview-text: Observe the travel path of the tailgate

warning.paragraph: Warning
The tailgate swings back and up when it opens. There is a risk of injury or risk of damage to property. Make sure that the travel path of the tailgate is clear during opening and closing.

overview.overview-text: Observe the travel path of the trunk lid

warning.paragraph: NOTICE

During opening, the trunk lid pivots back and up. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Make sure that the travel path of the trunk lid is clear during opening and closing.

overview.overview-text: Cover sharp and angular objects

warning.paragraph: NOTICE

Sharp-edged or pointed objects can hit the windows and heating elements while driving. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Cover the edges and ensure that pointed objects do not hit the windows.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: To avoid locking the vehicle key in the vehicle, do not place the vehicle key in the cargo area.
Depending on vehicle equipment and national-market version, the following settings can be changed:

item.paragraph: Whether the doors are also unlocked when unlocking with the vehicle key.
Whether the vehicle must be unlocked before unlocking with the vehicle key.

section.title: Functional requirements
section.paragraph: To open the cargo area with the vehicle key, the trailer power socket must not be occupied.
Selector lever position P must be engaged to open the cargo area with the vehicle key.
You must enable the setting for opening with the vehicle key.
Additional information:
Settings.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Press the button on the vehicle key for approx. 1 second.

section.title: Closing the cargo area

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Hold down the button on the vehicle key until cargo area is closed.
Releasing the button stops the movement.

section.paragraph: If the doors were not unlocked, the cargo area is locked again as soon as it has been closed.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: With Comfort Access, the cargo area can be accessed without activating the vehicle key.
The key is automatically detected near the vehicle.
Depending on the national-market version, compatible smartphones with a digital key are also detected automatically. In this case, the cargo area can be opened with a smartphone.
Additional information:
BMW Digital Key.
Carry the vehicle key with you, e.g., in your pants pocket.

item.paragraph: Carry the vehicle key with you, e.g., in your pants pocket.
Bluetooth must be activated on the smartphone to detect the Digital Key.
Unlock the vehicle and then press the button on the trunk.
With Comfort Access: carry the vehicle key with you and press the button on the trunk.
Locked doors are not unlocked.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Press the button on the trunk.

item.paragraph: Press the button on the trunk.
Press the button on the trunk.
The vehicle is locked after closing the cargo area. To do so, the driver's door must be closed and the vehicle key must be outside of the vehicle near the cargo area.

section.title: Functional requirements
section.paragraph: To open the cargo area using the button inside, the trailer power socket must not be occupied.
When the vehicle is locked, selector lever position P must be engaged before the trunk lid can be opened using the button in the vehicle interior.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Press the button in the storage compartment of the driver's door.

section.title: Closing the cargo area

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Pull and hold the button in the storage compartment of the driver's door.

section.paragraph: The vehicle key or the digital key must be located in the vehicle interior for this function.
An acoustic signal sounds before the trunk is closed.

section.title: Interruption of the opening procedure
section.paragraph: The opening procedure is interrupted in the following situations:

item.paragraph: When the vehicle starts moving.
By pressing the button on the outside of the cargo area. Pressing it again closes the cargo area again.
By pressing the button on the inside of the cargo area. Pressing it again closes the cargo area again.
By pressing the button on the vehicle key.
Pressing the button again continues the opening process.
Pressing and holding the button again closes the trunk again.
By pressing or pulling the button in the driver's door. Pressing again continues the opening procedure.

section.title: Interruption of the closing procedure
section.paragraph: The closing procedure is interrupted in the following situations:

item.paragraph: If the vehicle drives off with a jerky movement.
By pressing the button on the outside of the cargo area. Pressing it again opens the cargo area again.
By pressing the button on the inside of the cargo area. Pressing it again opens the cargo area again.
By releasing the button in the driver's door. Pulling again and holding continues the closing motion.
By releasing the button on the vehicle key.
Pressing the button again opens the trunk again.
Pressing again and holding continues the closing motion.

section.title: Touchless opening and closing of the cargo area
Principle
section.paragraph: Touchless opening and closing of the cargo area is possible when carrying the vehicle key on your person.
Two sensors detect a forward-directed foot movement in the central rear area and the cargo area is opened and closed.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The availability of the function depends on the equipment and the country.
If the vehicle key is within the sensor range, the cargo area may open or close inadvertently if you unintentionally move your foot or if a foot movement is detected.
The sensor has an approximate range of 1.50 m1.50 m, 5 ft5 ft/1.50 m extending from the rear area.
If contactless opening is used for the cargo area, the locked doors will not be unlocked.
Depending on national-market version, contactless opening of the cargo area is also possible for compatible smartphones with a Digital Key.
Additional information:
BMW Digital Key.

overview.overview-text: Do not touch vehicle

warning.paragraph: Warning

During no-touch activation, vehicle parts may be touched, such as the hot exhaust system. There is a risk of injury. When moving your foot, make sure you have a firm stance and do not touch the vehicle.

overview.overview-text: Keep the travel path of the trunk lid unobstructed

warning.paragraph: Warning
Body parts can be jammed when operating the trunk lid. There is a risk of injury. Make sure that the travel path of the trunk lid is clear during opening and closing.

overview.overview-text: Keep the travel path of the tailgate unobstructed

warning.paragraph: Warning
Body parts can be jammed when operating the tailgate. There is a risk of injury. Make sure that the travel path of the tailgate is clear during opening and closing.

overview.overview-text: Observe the travel path of the tailgate

warning.paragraph: Warning
The tailgate swings back and up when it opens. There is a risk of injury or risk of damage to property. Make sure that the travel path of the tailgate is clear during opening and closing.

overview.overview-text: Observe the travel path of the trunk lid

warning.paragraph: NOTICE

During opening, the trunk lid pivots back and up. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Make sure that the travel path of the trunk lid is clear during opening and closing.

overview.overview-text: Cover sharp and angular objects

warning.paragraph: NOTICE

Sharp-edged or pointed objects can hit the windows and heating elements while driving. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Cover the edges and ensure that pointed objects do not hit the windows.

section.title: Functional requirements

item.paragraph: To open the cargo area contactlessly, the trailer power socket must not be occupied.
To open the cargo area contactlessly, selector lever position P must be engaged.
Contactless opening and closing of the trunk must be activated in the settings.
Bluetooth must be activated on the smartphone to open and close the cargo area contactlessly using the Digital Key.

section.paragraph: Additional information:
Settings.

section.title: Opening the cargo area

action-step.paragraph: Stand in the middle behind the vehicle at approx. one arm's length away from the rear of the vehicle.
Wave a foot under the vehicle in the driving direction and immediately pull it back. With this movement, the leg must pass through the ranges of both sensors.

section.paragraph: Before the cargo area opens, the hazard warning system flashes.
Moving a foot again will stop the opening proccedure. The subsequent foot movement will close the cargo area again.

section.title: Closing the cargo area
section.paragraph: Perform the foot movement for opening the cargo area.
The hazard warning system flashes and an acoustic signal sounds.
Moving a foot again will stop the closing process. The subsequent foot movement will open the cargo area again.

section.title: System limits
section.paragraph: The detection of the foot movement may be limited due to the following external conditions:

item.paragraph: Ice, snow or slush on the rear of the vehicle.
Dirt or road salt on the rear of the vehicle.

section.paragraph: Movement in range of the sensors may cause unintended opening of the cargo area, for instance due to water running down when cleaning the vehicle or with heavy rainfall. To prevent such unintended opening of the cargo area in such cases, keep the vehicle key at a sufficient distance from the rear of the vehicle.

section.title: Malfunction
section.paragraph: In the event of an electrical malfunction, operate the unlocked trunk manually with a slow and smooth motion.

section.title: Trunk emergency unlocking
section.paragraph: The availability of the luggage compartment emergency release depends on the equipment.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Pull the handle inside the cargo area.
The trunk is unlocked.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The Key Card allows the vehicle to be unlocked and locked, as well as started.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The availability of the Key Card depends on the equipment and the country.
A digital key that has already been paired with the vehicle is installed on the Key Card. The digital key must be activated via iDrive.

Before leaving the vehicle, deactivate the Key Card or take the Key Card with you because the active Key Card can be used to start the vehicle. Always take the vehicle key with you to a service appointment.

overview.overview-text: Do not place Key Card and mobile device in the wireless charging tray at the same time

warning.paragraph: NOTICE

If the Key Card and a mobile device are in the wireless charging tray at the same time, the Key Card could become damaged. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Do not place the Key Card in the wireless charging tray at the same time as a mobile device.

section.title: Activating/deactivating Key Card in the vehicle
General information
section.paragraph: The Key Card must be located in the smartphone tray and a vehicle key must be located in the vehicle to activate the Key Card.
A vehicle key must be located in the vehicle to deactivate the Key Card.
When the BMW Digital Key is activated for the vehicle, a digital key can be used instead of the vehicle key.
A deactivated Key Card remains in the list of paired digital keys.

action-step.paragraph: Place Key Card in the center of the smartphone tray.
Follow instructions on the control display.

section.title: Deactivating Key Card
section.paragraph: A deactivated Key Card remains in the list of paired digital keys.

section.title: Unlocking and locking the vehicle
section.paragraph: The vehicle can be unlocked and locked with the activated Key Card.
Additional information:
Access to the vehicle interior.

section.title: Turning on the drive-ready state

action-step.paragraph: Place activated Key Card in the center of the smartphone tray.
Press the Start/Stop button.

section.paragraph: After drive readiness is switched on, the Key Card can be removed from the tray.

section.title: Malfunction
section.paragraph: The detection of the Key Card by the vehicle may be disrupted by objects between the sensors and the Key Card, such as a wallet or a smartphone cover.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: BMW Digital Key allows the vehicle to be unlocked and locked, as well as started, with a compatible smartphone.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Availability and range of functions of the BMW Digital Key depend on the equipment and national-market version.
BMW Digital Key can be used with a compatible smartphone or other compatible mobile devices.

To unlock and start a vehicle with a compatible smartphone, this function must be offered by the smartphone manufacturer. The BMW app provides a check to determine if the smartphone and the vehicle are compatible and which functions are supported.
A BMW ID or a driver profile with individual settings can be assigned to a digital key.

When using a smartphone as a Digital Key, always carry a vehicle key or the activated Key Card with you. This ensures access to the vehicle, even in the event of a smartphone failure. It is also helpful to have the vehicle key or Key Card with you if the vehicle needs to be handed over to another person. You can then hand over the vehicle key or the Key Card instead of your smartphone. Always take the vehicle key with you to a service appointment.
Additional information:

item.paragraph: BMW ID/driver profiles.
www.bmw.com/digitalkey.
The smartphone is compatible with BMW Digital Key
The vehicle is linked with the ConnectedDrive account of the vehicle owner.
The rechargeable battery of the smartphone has a sufficient charge. The necessary minimum charge of the rechargeable battery depends on the smartphone.

section.title: Enabling the digital remote control key
section.paragraph: Vehicle owner's smartphone is enabled as a digital remote control key in the vehicle. The vehicle owner must prove his authorization for the vehicle for this purpose.

Proof of authorization can be started via the BMW app or via the activation code in the corresponding smartphone function, e.g. in the Wallet app. Both vehicle keys must be in the vehicle during activation.
Follow the instructions in the Digital Key menu in the BMW app or on the Control Display.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Digital key allows the sharing of digital keys with other people. This option is available via the smartphone that is enabled as digital remote control key. This function must be supported by the smartphone.

section.title: Forwarding authorization
section.paragraph: To share the digital key, select the corresponding function on the smartphone, for instance in the Wallet app.
As soon as a digital key is shared with another person, the person will receive an invitation. When the invitation is accepted, the digital key on the recipient's smartphone will be activated.

section.title: Limiting the range of functions
section.paragraph: Certain functions of the digital key can be limited before handing it over. For instance, if the Digital Key is passed on to a novice driver, the switch-off for driving stability control systems can be disabled and the engine power can be reduced. For more information, refer to the ConnectedDrive portal and the BMW app.

section.title: Authentication
section.paragraph: Depending on the recipient’s smartphone model, an authentication may be required for security and safety reasons.
An authorized vehicle key, the digital remote control key or another method may be used for authentication. Follow the corresponding instructions on the smartphone or the Control Display.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Deleted digital keys will be removed from the list of enabled digital keys.
Deleted digital keys cannot be restored.

section.title: Deleting the digital master key
section.paragraph: The digital master key can be deleted from the smartphone or via iDrive.
The deletion of the digital master key is completed immediately.

section.title: Deleting a shared key
section.paragraph: Shared keys can be deleted via the smartphone with the digital remote control key, via the smartphone with a shared key or via iDrive.
The deletion via the smartphone using the digital remote control will not be performed until the vehicle is used with a key other than the key to be deleted.
The deletion via the smartphone with a shared key or via iDrive is executed immediately.

section.title: Deletion via iDrive
section.paragraph: To be able to delete a digital key via iDrive, an authorized vehicle key must be located in the vehicle or the remote control key must be located in the smartphone tray.

action-step.paragraph: If necessary, select the digital key.
Delete the Digital Key.

section.title: Resetting the function
section.paragraph: To reset the BMW Digital Key function, an authorized vehicle key must be located in the vehicle.
When resetting the BMW Digital Key function, all digital keys including the digital main key will be deleted. The Key Card digital key is not deleted.
After the reset, the vehicle can no longer be unlocked, locked or started with a digital key.
The digital remote control key must be enabled again to be able to use BMW Digital Key again.

section.title: Unlocking and locking the vehicle
section.paragraph: The vehicle can be unlocked and locked using the external door handle.
The vehicle can be unlocked and locked as follows:

item.paragraph: Via the external door handle.
With Comfort Access: depending on the national-market version, the vehicle can be locked and unlocked with no-touch activation.
Bluetooth must be activated on the smartphone for contactless unlocking and locking using the Digital Key.

section.paragraph: Additional information:
Access to the vehicle interior.

action-step.paragraph: Place smartphone in the center of the smartphone tray.
Ensure that the display is facing up.
Press the Start/Stop button to turn on the drive-ready state.

section.title: In the interior
section.paragraph: With Comfort Access, it is sufficient, depending on the country, for the smartphone with Bluetooth activated to be located inside the vehicle. Press the Start/Stop button to turn on the drive-ready state.

section.title: Sale of the smartphone
section.paragraph: Delete all digital keys on the smartphone prior to selling the smartphone. This ensures that the smartphone can no longer be used for the vehicle.

section.title: Sale of the vehicle
section.paragraph: Prior to selling a vehicle, reset the Digital Key function or remove the vehicle from the ConnectedDrive account of the current vehicle owner.
When the vehicle is removed from the ConnectedDrive account, all digital keys for the vehicle will be deleted. The Key Card digital key is not deleted.

section.title: System limits
section.paragraph: The interior motion sensor and tilt alarm sensor of the alarm system cannot be switched off with a digital key.
Additional information:
Alarm system.

section.title: Malfunction
section.paragraph: Digital key recognition by the vehicle may malfunction under the following circumstances:

item.paragraph: The smartphone is shielded from the sensors in the vehicle by a smartphone cover that is not suitable.
Objects such as a chip card or the Key Card are located between the smartphone and the smartphone cover.
Fault of the connection from transmission towers or other equipment with high transmitting power.
Shielding of the smartphone due to buildings or metal objects.

section.title: Buttons for the central locking system
General information
section.paragraph: The vehicle is automatically locked when driving off.
In the event of a severe accident, the vehicle is automatically unlocked. The hazard warning system and interior lights come on.

overview.overview-text: Always close the doors fully

warning.paragraph: Warning

When driving with a door open, passengers may be thrown from the vehicle. Careless opening of the door can pose a risk due to the flow of traffic. There is a risk of accident. Always close the doors fully. When opening the doors, make sure that the vehicle’s surroundings are secure.

section.title: Overview
section.paragraph: The central locking buttons are located on the front door.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Lock.
Unlock.
Open the door.

section.title: Locking the vehicle

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Press the button with the front doors closed.

section.paragraph: The vehicle is not secured against theft when locking.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Press the button.

section.title: Opening the door

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Press the button.

section.paragraph: The door is unlocked and slightly open.
Push the door outward.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: In case of a power failure, the driver's door can be unlocked manually.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Lever in the driver's door.
Pull the lever in the driver's door to unlock the driver's door.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The soft-close automatic function reduces the effort and noise when closing vehicle doors.
The door can be pushed into the door lock without effort and the door will close automatically.

overview.overview-text: Keep the travel path of the doors unobstructed

warning.paragraph: Warning
Body parts can be jammed while operating the doors. There is a risk of injury. Make sure that the area of movement of the doors is clear during opening and closing.

section.title: Closing
section.paragraph: To close the doors, push lightly.
The closing happens automatically.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: In the valet parking mode, the Control Display is disabled.
E.g., this mode can be used when the vehicle is handed over for valet parking.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Depending on the national-market version, the valet parking mode may not be available.
In the valet parking mode, it is not possible to change vehicle settings via iDrive. Settings stored in a BMW ID or a guest profile cannot be changed. Personal data cannot be displayed.
Additionally, the following actions are carried out:

item.paragraph: The volume of the audio system is limited.
The integrated Universal Remote Control is deactivated.
The Dynamic Stability Control cannot be turned off.
The availability of certain settings of the driving modes is limited.

section.paragraph: Additional information:
BMW ID/driver profiles.

section.title: Functional requirement
section.paragraph: The driver has registered in the vehicle with a BMW ID.

action-step.paragraph: The cargo area is locked and disconnected from the central locking system.
If necessary, "PIN"
If the active BMW ID does not have an assigned PIN, this PIN must be set now. The PIN is needed to deactivate the valet parking mode.
If necessary, enter the PIN.
Select the desired BMW ID on the lock screen.

item.paragraph: Enter the assigned PIN for the BMW ID.
If you have forgotten the PIN: enter the access data for the BMW ID.
If the selected BMW ID does not have an assigned PIN: enter the access data for the BMW ID.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Depending on the equipment and national-market version, various settings for opening and closing are possible.

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired setting:

item.paragraph: Only the driver's door and the fuel filler flap are unlocked. Pressing again unlocks the entire vehicle.
Only the driver's door and the charging socket cover are unlocked. Pressing again unlocks the entire vehicle.
Only the driver's door is unlocked. Pressing again unlocks the entire vehicle.
The entire vehicle is unlocked.
The entire vehicle is unlocked.
If the button on the vehicle key is pressed twice directly consecutively, the window is lowered more when the door is opened next.

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired setting:
Select the desired setting:
After drive readiness is switched off, the locked vehicle is unlocked automatically by pressing the start/stop button or engaging selector lever position P.
The vehicle locks automatically after a short period of time if no door is opened after unlocking.
Deactivate or activate the desired confirmation signals:

item.paragraph: Unlocking is signaled by blinking twice, locking by blinking once.
With alarm system:
Unlocking is confirmed with two sound signals, locking is confirmed with one sound signal.

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired setting:

item.paragraph: Depending on the equipment, the cargo area will be unlocked or opened.
Depending on the equipment, the trunk will be unlocked or opened and the doors are unlocked.

paragraph.textref: "Tailgate will only open if vehicle is already unlocked"

item.paragraph: The vehicle must be unlocked before the cargo area can be operated with the vehicle key.
Operating the cargo area with the vehicle key is disabled.

section.title: Adjusting the opening height
section.paragraph: You can set how far the tailgate can be opened.
When adjusting the opening height, make sure the clearance above the tailgate is at least 10 cm 10 cm, approx. 4 in 4 in/10 cm.

action-step.paragraph: Monitor the tailgate and set the desired opening height.

section.title: Opening/closing the cargo area with no-touch activation

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired setting:

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The alarm system issues a visual and acoustic signal when someone attempts to open the locked vehicle incorrectly.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: When the vehicle is locked, the vehicle alarm system reacts to the following changes:

item.paragraph: Opening a door, the hood, or the cargo area.
Movements in the interior.
Changes in the vehicle inclination, such as during attempts at stealing a wheel or when towing the vehicle.
Disconnected battery voltage.
Improper use of the socket for OBD on-board diagnostics.
Locking the vehicle while a device is connected to the diagnostic socket.

section.paragraph: The alarm system signals these changes visually and acoustically:

item.paragraph: Acoustic alarm:
Depending on local regulations, the acoustic alarm may be suppressed.
Optical alarm:
By blinking of the hazard warning system and headlights, where required.

section.paragraph: Do not modify the system to ensure function of the alarm system.

section.title: Turning the alarm system on/off
section.paragraph: The alarm system is turned off or on as soon as the vehicle is unlocked or locked.

section.title: Opening the doors with the alarm system switched on
section.paragraph: The alarm system is triggered when a door is opened if the door was unlocked using the integrated key in the door lock.

section.title: Opening the cargo area with the alarm system switched on
section.paragraph: The cargo area can be opened even when the alarm system is switched on.
After closing the cargo area, the cargo area will be locked and monitored again. The hazard warning system blinks once during closing.

section.title: Panic mode
section.paragraph: You can trigger the alarm system if you find yourself in a dangerous situation.

item.paragraph: Press the button on the vehicle key and hold for at least 3 seconds.
Briefly press the button on the vehicle key three times in succession.

section.paragraph: To switch off the alarm: press any button.

section.title: Indicator light on the interior mirror

item.paragraph: The indicator light flashes briefly every 2 seconds:
The alarm system is switched on.
Indicator light flashes for approx. 10 seconds, then it flashes briefly every 2 seconds:
Interior motion sensor and tilt alarm sensor are not active, as doors, hood, or tailgate are not correctly closed. Correctly closed access points are secured.
When the remaining open access points are closed, the interior motion sensor and tilt alarm sensor will be turned on.
The indicator light goes out after unlocking:
The vehicle has not been tampered with.
The indicator light flashes after unlocking until drive-ready state is switched on, but no longer than approx. 5 minutes:
An alarm has been deployed.

section.title: Tilt alarm sensor
section.paragraph: The inclination of the vehicle is monitored.
The alarm system responds in situations such as attempts to steal a wheel or when the vehicle is towed.

section.title: Interior motion sensor
section.paragraph: The vehicle interior is monitored.
The alarm system responds when movement is detected in the vehicle interior.
The windows must be closed for the system to function properly.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The tilt alarm sensor and interior motion sensor can trigger an alarm, although no unauthorized action occurred.
Possible situations for an unwanted alarm:

item.paragraph: In car washes.
In duplex garages.
During transport on trains carrying vehicles, at sea or on a trailer.
With animals in the vehicle.
When the vehicle is locked after start of refueling.

section.paragraph: The tilt alarm sensor and the interior motion sensor can be switched off in such situations.

title.pcdata-case: Switching off the tilt alarm sensor and interior motion sensor

item.paragraph: Press the button on the vehicle key within 10 seconds as soon as the vehicle is locked.
The indicator light lights up for approx. 2 seconds and then continues to flash.
After turning off the standby state, an option to turn off the interior motion sensor and the tilt alarm sensor will be displayed on the control display.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Press the button on the vehicle key within 10 seconds as soon as the vehicle is locked.
The indicator light lights up for approx. 2 seconds and then continues to flash.

section.paragraph: The tilt alarm sensor and interior motion sensor are switched off until the vehicle is locked again.

section.title: Ending the alarm
section.paragraph: Unlock the vehicle.
If the vehicle is unlocked with the integrated key, the drive readiness must subsequently be turned on via the emergency detection of the vehicle key.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: When a window is frequently opened to the same position, this task can be performed by the BMW Intelligent Personal Assistant. For instance when the same parking garage is frequently used.
Additional information:
BMW Intelligent Personal Assistant.

overview.overview-text: Keep the travel path of the windows unobstructed

warning.paragraph: Warning

When operating the windows, body parts and objects can be jammed. There is a risk of injury or risk of damage to property. Make sure that the travel path of the windows is clear during opening and closing.

section.title: Opening windows

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Press and hold the button on the vehicle key after unlocking.

section.paragraph: The windows open for as long as the button on the vehicle key is pressed.

section.title: Closing the windows

graphic-with-description.paragraph: With Comfort Access: press and hold the button on the vehicle key after locking.

section.paragraph: The windows close for as long as the button on the vehicle key is pressed.
Depending on the vehicle equipment, exterior mirrors are folded in unless they were folded in while locking. The exterior mirrors are not folded in when the hazard warning flashers are switched on.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The windows can be closed using the external door handle without operating the vehicle key.
The vehicle key is automatically detected near the vehicle.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The function is available with Comfort Access.
Depending on the national-market version, the windows can also be closed at the external door handle with compatible smartphones with digital key.
Additional information:
BMW Digital Key.
Carry the vehicle key with you, for instance in your pants pocket.

item.paragraph: Carry the vehicle key with you, for instance in your pants pocket.
Bluetooth must be activated on the smartphone to close the window(s) using the digital key.

section.title: Closing the windows

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Touch the grooved surface on the external door handle of a closed front door with your finger and hold it there without grasping the recessed grip.

section.paragraph: In addition to locking, the windows also closed.
In addition to locking, the windows and glass sunroof with sun protection will be closed.
Depending on the vehicle equipment, exterior mirrors are folded in unless they were folded in while locking. The exterior mirrors are not folded in when the hazard warning flashers are switched on.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Power windows

section.title: Functional requirements
section.paragraph: The windows can be operated under the following conditions.

item.paragraph: Standby state is switched on.
Drive-ready state is switched on.
For a short while after idle state has been established.

section.paragraph: The vehicle key or a digital key must be inside of the vehicle.

item.paragraph: Press the switch to the resistance point.
The window opens while the switch is being held.
Press the switch beyond the resistance point.
The window opens automatically. Pressing the switch again stops the motion.
Pull the switch to the resistance point.
The window closes while the switch is being held.
Pull the switch beyond the resistance point.
The window closes automatically. Pulling again stops the motion.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The jam protection prevents objects or body parts becoming jammed between the door frame and window while a window is being closed.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: If resistance or blockage is detected while a window is being closed, the closing will be interrupted.

overview.overview-text: Keep the travel path of the windows unobstructed

warning.paragraph: Warning
Accessories on the windows such as antennas can impact jam protection. There is a risk of injury. Do not install accessories in the area of movement of the windows.

section.title: Closing without the jam protection system
section.paragraph: In case of danger from the outside or if icing might prevent normal closing, proceed as follows:

action-step.paragraph: Pull the switch past the resistance point and hold it there.
The window closes with limited jam protection. If the closing force exceeds a specific threshold, closing is interrupted.
Pull the switch past the resistance point again within approx. 4 seconds and hold it there.
The window closes without jam protection.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: With the safety switch, it is possible to disable particular functions in the rear. The locking of functions is useful, for instance, when children or animals are carried in the rear.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The following functions can be disabled by pressing the safety switch:

item.paragraph: Opening and closing of the rear windows using the switches in the rear.
Opening of rear doors by passengers in the rear.
The rear doors can only be opened from the outside.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Safety switch
Press the button.
The LED lights up if the safety function is switched on.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The glass sunroof can be set either transparent or opaque for sun protection and screen.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The glass sunroof is automatically set opaque when the vehicle with a transparent glass sunroof is exited.
If the vehicle is unlocked within approx. 24 hours, the glass sunroof will automatically switch to the transparent state.

overview.overview-text: Do not put your face and body outside of the closing path

warning.paragraph: Warning

Unintended closing of the slide/tilt sunroof may cause body parts to become jammed. There is a risk of injury. Make sure that the area of movement of the slide/tilt sunroof is clear. Take the vehicle key with you to make sure children cannot play with the slide/tilt sunroof.

overview.overview-text: Keep the travel path of the glass sunroof unobstructed

warning.paragraph: Warning
Body parts can be jammed when operating the glass sunroof. There is a risk of injury. Make sure that the area of movement of the glass sunroof is clear during opening and closing.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Glass sunroof

section.title: Functional requirements
section.paragraph: The glass sunroof can be operated under the following conditions.

item.paragraph: Standby state is switched on.
Drive-ready state is switched on.

section.title: Opening glass sunroof

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Press and hold the button on the vehicle key after unlocking.

section.paragraph: The glass sunroof with sun protection will be opened for as long as the button on the vehicle key is pressed.
For safety reasons, the opening procedure is stopped after approx. 10 seconds. Press the button again if the opening procedure is not yet finished.

section.title: Closing glass sunroof

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Press and hold the button on the vehicle key after locking.
With Comfort Access: press and hold the button on the vehicle key in close range of the vehicle after locking.

section.paragraph: The glass sunroof with sun protection will be closed for as long as the button on the vehicle key is pressed.
Depending on the vehicle equipment, exterior mirrors are folded in unless they were folded in while locking. The exterior mirrors are not folded in when the hazard warning flashers are switched on.
For safety reasons, the closing motion is stopped after approx. 10 seconds. Press the button again if the closing motion is not yet finished.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The glass sunroof can be closed using the external door handle without operating the vehicle key.
The vehicle key is automatically detected near the vehicle.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The function is available with Comfort Access.
Depending on the country, the glass sunroof can also be closed at the external door handle using compatible smartphones with Digital Key.
Additional information:
BMW Digital Key.
Carry the vehicle key with you, for instance in your pants pocket.

item.paragraph: Carry the vehicle key with you, for instance in your pants pocket.
Bluetooth must be activated on the smartphone to close the glass sunroof using the Digital Key.

section.title: Closing glass sunroof
section.paragraph: In addition to locking, the windows and glass sunroof with sun protection will be closed.
Depending on the vehicle equipment, exterior mirrors are folded in unless they were folded in while locking. The exterior mirrors are not folded in when the hazard warning flashers are switched on.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Press the button.

item.paragraph: The opaque glass sunroof is set transparent.
The transparent glass sunroof is set opaque.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The glass sunroof and the sun protection are operated using the same switch.

section.title: Functional requirements
section.paragraph: The glass sunroof and sun protection can be operated under the following conditions.

item.paragraph: Standby state is switched on.
Drive-ready state is switched on.
For a short while after idle state has been established.

section.paragraph: The vehicle key must be in the car's interior.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Push switch briefly upward.

item.paragraph: The closed glass sunroof tilts and the sun protection opens slightly.
The opened glass sunroof closes until it is in the tilted position. The sun protection does not move.
The tilted glass sunroof closes.

section.title: Opening/closing the glass sunroof and sun protection separately

item.paragraph: Slide switch back to the resistance point and hold.
Holding down the switch opens the sun protection. If the sun protection is already fully open, the glass sunroof opens.
Slide switch forward to the resistance point and hold.
The glass sunroof closes while the switch is being held. If the glass sunroof is already closed or in the tilted position, the sun protection closes.
Slide the switch back past the resistance point.
The sun protection opens automatically. If the sun protection is already fully open, the glass sunroof opens automatically.
Pressing the switch again stops the motion.
Push the switch forward past the resistance point.
The glass sunroof closes automatically. If the glass sunroof is already closed or in the tilted position, the sun protection closes automatically.
Pressing the switch again stops the motion.

section.title: Opening/closing the glass sunroof and sun protection together

item.paragraph: Briefly press out the switch twice in succession toward the rear past the resistance point.
The glass sunroof and sun protection open together.
Pressing the switch again stops the motion.
Briefly press out the switch twice in succession toward the front past the resistance point.
The glass sunroof and sun protection close together.
Pressing the switch again stops the motion.

section.title: Comfort position
section.paragraph: In some models, the wind noises in the car's interior are lowest when the glass sunroof is not fully open. In these models, the automatic function initially only opens the glass sunroof up to this comfort position.
Pressing the switch in the vehicle interior again opens the glass sunroof fully.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The jam protection prevents objects or body parts from becoming jammed between the roof frame and glass sunroof while the glass sunroof is closing.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: If a resistance or blockage is detected while the glass sunroof is closing, the closing operation is interrupted once the roof reaches the half-open position, or it is stopped when closing from the tilted position.

section.title: Closing from the open position without jam protection
section.paragraph: In case of danger from the outside or if icing might prevent normal closing, proceed as follows:

action-step.paragraph: Close all doors.
Push the switch forward past the resistance point and hold.
The glass sunroof closes with limited jam protection. If the closing force exceeds a specific threshold, closing is interrupted.
Push the switch forward again past the resistance point and hold until the glass sunroof closes without jam protection. Make sure that the closing path is clear.

section.title: Closing from the lifted position without jam protection
section.paragraph: In case of danger from the outside or if icing might prevent normal closing, proceed as follows:

action-step.paragraph: Close all doors.
Push the switch forward past the resistance point and hold.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: After a power interruption during the opening or closing process, the glass sunroof can only be operated to a limited extent. Initializing the system can help in this case.
The system can be initialized under the following conditions:

item.paragraph: The vehicle is parked in a horizontal position.
The vehicle will not be moved until the initialization is completed.
The drive-ready state is established.
The outside temperature is above 5 ℃5 ℃/41 ℉41 ℉/5 ℃.

section.paragraph: During initialization, the glass sunroof closes without jam protection.
Make sure that the closing path is clear.

section.title: Initializing the system

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Press the switch up and hold it until the initialization is complete:

section.paragraph: Initialization begins within 15 seconds.

item.paragraph: If the glass sunroof is closed, it opens then closes again.
If the glass sunroof is open, it first closes, then opens and closes again.

section.paragraph: Initialization is complete once the glass sunroof and the sun protection have opened then closed again.

section.title: Functional limitations
section.paragraph: The degree of transparency may vary at extreme temperatures.
